message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylase inhibitors cause an increase in acetylation of histones, leading to a more relaxed chromatin structure and increased expression of genes. This is due to the fact that acetylation neutralizes the positive charge of lysine, reducing its affinity for negatively charged DNA and relaxing DNA coiling. Therefore, the correct answer is B - relaxation of DNA coiling.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylases remove acetyl groups from histones, leading to tighter coiling of DNA and suppression of gene transcription. A histone deacetylase inhibitor will prevent this process, leading to relaxation of DNA coiling and potentially increased gene transcription.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylase inhibitors cause relaxation of DNA coiling, leading to increased access of transcription factors and RNA polymerase to genes, which can result in increased gene transcription. This can have therapeutic potential in cancer treatment as it can arrest the cell cycle and induce apoptosis in cancer cells. Tighter coiling of DNA is associated with decreased gene expression and heterochromatin formation. Suppression of gene transcription is not typically associated with histone deacetylase inhibitors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylase inhibitors lead to hyperacetylation of histones, which causes relaxation of DNA coiling and increased accessibility of genes for transcription. Therefore, (B) is the correct answer. Tighter coiling of DNA and increased heterochromatin formation would lead to decreased accessibility of genes for transcription. Suppression of gene transcription is not necessarily the result, as some genes may actually be upregulated by histone deacetylase inhibitors.

This function has been explored in cancer treatment as it can induce apoptosis in cancer cells. Tighter coiling of DNA would prevent gene expression, suppression of gene transcription, and increased heterochromatin formation.

Therefore, an inhibitor of histone deacetylases would cause relaxation of DNA coiling and potentially increased gene expression.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylase inhibitors cause histone hyperacetylation, meaning that there will be more acetyl groups on histones. Acetylated histones have a more relaxed structure, leading to relaxation of DNA coiling. This in turn can enhance gene transcription.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Histone deacetylase inhibitors cause relaxation of DNA coiling, which leads to increased expression of certain genes. This is because histone acetylation is associated with increased gene transcription. Therefore, inhibiting histone deacetylases leads to histone hyperacetylation and increased gene expression. Tighter coiling of DNA, suppression of gene transcription, and increased heterochromatin formation are not associated with histone deacetylase inhibitor activity.
